questions.text: Where does the first scene of the show take place?
questions.explanation:
Ireland.

	In the first scene, Thomas Andrews sings "In Every Age". Set in Ireland,  it describes the Titanic as a "floating city". In the original Broadway cast, Andrews was played by Michael Cerveris.

questions.text: How much does it cost Barrett to send a telegram?
questions.explanation:
Nothing.

	Although it would normally cost more money than Barrett stands to make on the trip simply to send a telegram, Harold Bride, the telegraph operator, decides to give him a special discount, and the telegram is sent for free. Barrett was originally played by Brian d'Arcy James.

questions.text: Complete the song title: "The ______________ was Alive"
questions.explanation:
Night.

	"The Night Was Alive" is sung by Harold Bride, a young telegraph operator who is amazed with the possibility of the invention. Harold Bride was originally played by Martin Moran.

questions.text: According to Barrett, how many stories is Titanic?
questions.explanation:
Eleven.

	"Forty-six thousand tons of steelEleven stories high!She's a great floating palace, floatingQuiet as a lullaby"-Barrett, "How Did They Build Titanic?"

questions.text: Thomas Andrews, the engineer who designed the Titanic, works for Andrews and Wolff.
questions.explanation:
False.

	Thomas Andrews is employed by Harland and Wolff, not Andrews and Wolff. This is mentioned by J. Bruce Ismay when he is trying to avoid the blame for the inevitable sinking.

questions.text: How many potatoes does Titanic carry, according to the song "Loading Inventory"?
questions.explanation:
Forty Tons.

	In the song "Loading Inventory", the cast is doing just that, as various crew members sing out the amounts of food. Some other trivia according to the song: the Titanic carried seven thousand heads of fresh lettuce, thirty-six thousand oranges and forty-two thousand fresh eggs.

questions.text: Which first-class passengers got the A-62 cabin?
questions.explanation:
The Astors.

	John Jacob Astor and his wife of less than a year, Madeline, have twenty-nine years between them, she being only nineteen. She is already seven months pregnant with his child when the show takes place.

questions.text: Which character insists that the ship go as fast as possible?
questions.explanation:
J. Bruce Ismay

	The owner of the ship, J. Bruce Ismay, is portrayed as a villain with no redeemable qualities and is given no sympathy from Peter Stone, who wrote the book to Maury Yeston's music and lyrics. Andrews estimates Titanic's speed at twenty-three knots.

questions.text: What dish do the Widener's love?
questions.explanation:
Kidney pie.

	This fact is mentioned in "What A Remarkable Age This Is", sung by Henry Etches and the dining staff aboard the ship. Furthermore, Mister Astor takes his toast dry, and Mrs. Strauss prefers her grouse with the sauce on the side.

questions.text: In "Lady's Maid", which character reveals that she is pregnant?
questions.explanation:
Kate McGowan.

	In the original Broadway cast, Kate McGowan was played by Jennifer Piech, who also played a First Class Passenger. Kate McGowan reveals she is pregnant towards the end of the song. She also sings in "No Moon", where she flirts with Jim Farrell.
